channel.title: Help with a banner
channel.description:
http://junk.sneamia.net/remcoffee/
So that's a site I'm working on, for a client. I need pointers on the banner. Something that would go with the smooth and simple theme.

item.title: Help with a banner
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Just a comment on the website itself, the text in the flavors part is boring. Maby you were planning on changing it. It’s just a way to big list.

Another comment on the website, I think the shadows are a bit too hard. But thats just me.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a banner
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I don’t understand how that was funny, AT ALL. I am trying to help him. All you did was offer up some sort of idea, and then when he asked how that was supposed to fit the scheme, you just shrugged it off. As if he doesn’t have the intelligence to know how it might work. I personally don’t see how your idea would work at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a banner
item.dc:creator: @YupolaScape YupolaScape
item.description:
@YupolaScape wrote:

Then say:
MILK CHOCOLATE TO LIGHTER BROWN RADIAL GRADIENT
MOUND OF COFFEE BEANS AT CENTER OF RADIAL GRADIENT.

Capitals were used to get my point across in a patronising kind of way

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a banner
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:5, topic:193523”]Hmm… I guess I can help you out. Main thing is, it looks like a Monk commercial. Pristine white background, white coffee cup, with a perfect cup of Joe. Your best bet is to Use a coffee bean background, not to much, like a mound, getting taller as it reaches the middle, then have the white background behind it. You would then round the corners, not too much. Maybe a 6 px. That should be good enough, I don’t know, if you get around to making my idea, I can probably help from there.

EDIT:

I changed my mind, this is what it needs to be. Dark brown, maybe a shade of milk chocolate, smoothly transitions into a lighter brown, like toffee. Toffee being the dominant color of the radial gradient. So maybe just hint at the sides with the dark milk chocolate. But it can’t be a bland toffee color throughout the entire thing, it still needs to be a gradient, so make it a straight dark to light. But stretch out the in between colors as much as you can. Then put the mound of coffee beans in front, making it so the highest point on the mound is in the dead center of the Gradient.[/quote]
legit is scared shitless by images.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a banner
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Hmm… I guess I can help you out. Main thing is, it looks like a Monk commercial. Pristine white background, white coffee cup, with a perfect cup of Joe. Your best bet is to Use a coffee bean background, not to much, like a mound, getting taller as it reaches the middle, then have the white background behind it. You would then round the corners, not too much. Maybe a 6 px. That should be good enough, I don’t know, if you get around to making my idea, I can probably help from there.

EDIT:

I changed my mind, this is what it needs to be. Dark brown, maybe a shade of milk chocolate, smoothly transitions into a lighter brown, like toffee. Toffee being the dominant color of the radial gradient. So maybe just hint at the sides with the dark milk chocolate. But it can’t be a bland toffee color throughout the entire thing, it still needs to be a gradient, so make it a straight dark to light. But stretch out the in between colors as much as you can. Then put the mound of coffee beans in front, making it so the highest point on the mound is in the dead center of the Gradient.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with a banner
item.dc:creator: @YupolaScape YupolaScape
item.description:
@YupolaScape wrote:

I do web developing, and I personally think that the theme is too square if its going with the current banner of a liquid, a drink. As for a banner idea, I would have a still pool of water with a random droplet going down into it, then simplistic text which blends with the colours well.

Read full topic
